text:
*Anyone got thoughts on how the file structure should work for crankshaft?*
Think about your workflow, think how it could be done in a better way.
<https://github.com/TheWebTech/CrankShaft/issues/22>
i think the structure looks pretty good.
as i have said, i have a tendency to break down my css files quite a bit, but that may not be how all like to work

yea, as a couple people have noted we’ll separate the variables and macros out similar to how the  HS boilerplate did it.

We’re also going to separate out any large chunks that might be optional or make sense to organize in their own file: the grid css is a perfect example

I should add one thing I want to do is conciously try to limit how intertangled the files are though.

an example reason for this is how complicated the bootstrap scss files are
haha… I just suggested a more complicated structure on github.

I think your structure isn’t too complicated but we do need to be conscious of it.  Maybe we’ll try to set an arbitrary depth limit for includes to prevent it getting too gnarly.

The more segmented it is, the harder it is for people to contribute, and the harder it is for people to work with and understand.
I can already tell a mindmap type thing for displaying how the files interact is probably going to be necessary.

I’ve created a branch with the file structure all scaffolded out. (files that are in-place don’t have actual contents yet)

<https://github.com/TheWebTech/CrankShaft/tree/file-structuring/CrankShaft>

put up a PR

Anyone interested in using the framework please review the file structure provide any feedback if you have it.
<https://github.com/TheWebTech/CrankShaft/pull/27>

We're trying to move quickly so if you dont weigh in we will keep moving and you'll be late to offer input
